collection:
This privacy policy document outlines what type of personal information is
collected and stored by _PolyTech Forum_ and how it is used.

### Website Visitors

Like most website operators, _PolyTech Forum_ collects non-personally-
identifying information of the sort that web browsers and servers typically
make available, such as the browser type, language preference, referring site,
and the date and time of each visitor request.

_PolyTech Forum_ 's purpose in
collecting non-personally identifying information is to better understand how
_PolyTech Forum_ 's visitors use its website.

_PolyTech Forum_ also collects potentially personally-identifying information
like Internet Protocol (IP) addresses for logged in users and for users
leaving comments on _PolyTech Forum_ forums.

### Gathering of Personally-Identifying Information

Certain visitors to _PolyTech Forum_ 's websites choose to interact with
_PolyTech Forum_ in ways that require _PolyTech Forum_ to gather personally-
identifying information.

The amount and type of information that _PolyTech
Forum_ gathers depends on the nature of the interaction.

For example, we ask
visitors who sign up for a forum user account at _PolyTech Forum_ to provide a
username and email address.

In each case, _PolyTech Forum_ collects
such information only insofar as is necessary or appropriate to fulfill the
purpose of the visitor's interaction with _PolyTech Forum_.

### Aggregated Statistics

_PolyTech Forum_ may collect statistics about the behavior of visitors to its
websites.

_PolyTech Forum_ uses cookies to help _PolyTech Forum_
identify and track visitors, their usage of _PolyTech Forum_ website, and
their website access preferences.

These cookies allow the ad server to recognize
your computer each time they send you an online advertisement to compile
information about you or others who use your computer.
They automatically receive your IP address when this occurs.
sharing:
From time to time, _PolyTech
Forum_ may release non-personally-identifying information in the aggregate,
e.g., by publishing a report on trends in the usage of its website.

_PolyTech Forum_ only discloses
logged in user and commenter IP addresses under the same circumstances that it
uses and discloses personally-identifying information as described below,
except that blog commenter IP addresses are visible and disclosed to the
administrators of the blog where the comment was left.

_PolyTech Forum_
does not disclose personally-identifying information other than as described
below.

_PolyTech Forum_ may display this information publicly or provide it
to others.

However, _PolyTech Forum_ does not disclose personally-identifying
information other than as described below.

### Protection of Certain Personally-Identifying Information

_PolyTech Forum_ discloses potentially personally-identifying and personally-
identifying information only to those of its employees, contractors and
affiliated organizations that (i) need to know that information in order to
process it on _PolyTech Forum_ 's behalf or to provide services available at
_PolyTech Forum_ 's websites, and (ii) that have agreed not to disclose it to
others.

Some of those employees, contractors and affiliated organizations may
be located outside of your home country; by using _PolyTech Forum_ 's
websites, you consent to the transfer of such information to them.

_PolyTech
Forum_ will not rent or sell potentially personally-identifying and
personally-identifying information to anyone.

Other than to its employees,
contractors and affiliated organizations, as described above, _PolyTech Forum_
discloses potentially personally-identifying and personally-identifying
information only in response to a subpoena, court order or other governmental
request, or when _PolyTech Forum_ believes in good faith that disclosure is
reasonably necessary to protect the property or rights of _PolyTech Forum_ ,
third parties or the public at large.

### Business Transfers

If _PolyTech Forum_ , or substantially all of its assets were acquired, or in
the unlikely event that _PolyTech Forum_ goes out of business or enters
bankruptcy, user information would be one of the assets that is transferred or
acquired by a third party.

You acknowledge that such transfers may occur, and
that any acquiror of _PolyTech Forum_ may continue to use your personal
information as set forth in this policy.

This information allows
ad networks to, among other things, deliver targeted advertisements that they
believe will be of most interest to you.
* Google's use of the DoubleClick cookie enables it and its partners to serve ads to PolyTech Forum users based on their visit to PolyTech Forum and/or other sites on the Internet.

* Users may opt out of the use of the DoubleClick cookie for interest-based advertising by visiting [aboutads.info](http://aboutads.info)

Third-party ad servers or ad networks use technology to send the
advertisements and links that appear on _PolyTech Forum_ directly to your
browsers.
